item.title: Porsche 911 Carrera S unveiled globally - EVO India
item.description:
Porsche 911 Carrera S Unveiled Globally

Published on: 09 Jan 2025, 06:48

Porsche has unveiled the new 911 Carrera S, which is now part of the 911 lineup and available in both coupe and convertible body styles. This model features a more powerful engine and additional equipment compared to the standard Carrera.

  • The Carrera S is positioned between the Carrera and Carrera GTS models.
  • The new sports car is based on the design of previous 911 Turbo models, with minor design changes like staggered 20/21-inch wheels and Matrix LED headlights.
  • The interior includes a standard black leather package, optional rear seats for the coupe, and advanced tech features like a wireless phone charger.
  • The 3-litre twin-turbo engine produces 473bhp and 530Nm of torque, with capabilities of 0 to 100 km/h in 3.3 seconds and a top speed of 308 km/h.
  • Expect pricing for the Carrera S to exceed ₹2 crore in India.
Porsche has fitted new turbochargers and has extensively optimised the charge-air cooling.

This unveiling marks an exciting addition to Porsche's 911 lineup, promising both performance and luxury for sports car enthusiasts.

item.title: Apple could launch iPhone SE 4, new iPad models in April: What to expect - Business Standard
item.description:
Apple could launch iPhone SE 4, new iPad models in April

Publication Date: N/A Source: Bloomberg

Apple's first launch of 2025 is expected to be in April with the introduction of the fourth-generation iPhone SE and new iPad models.

  • The new iPhone SE is expected to feature a modern design and significant updates.
  • Mark Gurman from Bloomberg indicates that the devices will launch before the release of iOS 18.4, likely by April.
  • The iPhone SE 4 will reportedly have the A18 chip, 8GB of RAM, and storage starting at 128GB.
  • Camera improvements include a 48MP rear sensor and a 12MP front camera, with a battery capacity increase from 2,018mAh to 3,279mAh.
  • The new iPads anticipated include the 11th-generation base iPad and an updated iPad Air featuring an M3 chip.
“The new iPads and iPhone SE replacement are being developed on the iOS 18.3 train... they’ll launch before iOS 18.4, by April if all goes to plan.” - Mark Gurman

In conclusion, Apple fans may look forward to significant updates in the iPhone SE and iPad lines by April 2025.

item.title: Apple’s iOS 18.3 Public Beta 2 released: Calculator function restored, bug fixes and more | Mint - Mint
item.description:
Apple’s iOS 18.3 Public Beta 2 released: Calculator function restored, bug fixes and more

Publication Date: March 2023

Source: Business Today

Cupertino-based Apple has reportedly released iOS 18.3 Public Beta 2, offering a glimpse at the upcoming software update.

According to a report, the latest beta introduces minor enhancements aimed at refining the user experience, including a key update to the Calculator app and several bug fixes.

  • Calculator Feature Restored: The beta restores a previously removed function, allowing users to repeat calculations by pressing the equals button.
  • Expanding Home App Functionality: Continued development for integrating compatible robot vacuums into the Home app.
  • Bug Fixes and Performance Enhancements: A focus on essential bug fixes and optimizations for a smoother user experience.
  • How to Access the Update: Existing public beta users can install it via Settings > Software Update; new users must enroll in the Beta Software Programme.
  • What Lies Ahead: iOS 18.3 is expected to be less feature-heavy, with more significant features anticipated in the upcoming iOS 18.4 release.

For those keen to explore the latest changes, iOS 18.3 Public Beta 2 provides a chance to test refinements ahead of the full release.

item.title: Poco X7 series launching today: Expected Indian prices, leaked specifications and everything we know so far | Mint - Mint
item.description:
Poco X7 Series Launch Today: Expected Prices and Specifications

Publication Date: January 9

Source: LiveMint

Poco is preparing to launch its highly anticipated Poco X7 Series today, which promises significant improvements in the mid-range smartphone market, featuring the Poco X7 and Poco X7 Pro.

The Poco X7 Series aims to deliver high performance at an affordable price, catering to users looking for efficiency in demanding tasks.

Key Points:

  • Unique design with a Black and Yellow dual-tone color scheme.
  • Poco X7 Pro includes a vertically aligned dual-camera, while the X7 features a square camera module.
  • Iron Man Edition of the Poco X7 Pro available in red and gold.
  • Poco X7 Pro powered by MediaTek Dimensity 8300 Ultra with a 6550mAh battery and 90W fast charging.
  • Poco X7 expected to have a 1.5K 3D curved AMOLED display, 120Hz refresh rate, and a 50MP primary sensor.
  • Pricing speculated to be under ₹30,000 for Poco X7 Pro and below ₹25,000 for standard Poco X7.
“The Poco X7 Series is aimed at delivering high-performance capabilities at an affordable price.”

In conclusion, the Poco X7 series is set to make a significant impact in the smartphone market, offering advanced features at competitive prices.

item.title: Oppo Reno 13 series to launch in India today: Price, specs and everything we know - India Today
item.description:
Oppo Reno 13 series launches in India today

Published On: Jan 9, 2025
Source: Unnati Gusain

The Oppo Reno 13 series is officially launching in India today, featuring two models: the Reno 13 and the Reno 13 Pro, with notable differences in battery capacity and camera specifications.

  • The Reno 13 Pro boasts a 5800mAh battery, while the vanilla variant has a 5600mAh battery.
  • A live stream of the launch is available on Oppo's official YouTube channel at 5 pm today.
  • The series emphasizes AI-driven features and premium design with an aerospace-grade aluminum frame.
  • It will be the first in India to use the MediaTek Dimensity 8350 chipset.
  • Pre-orders start today, with detailed sale information to follow.
  • The expected starting price for the Reno 13 is Rs 37,999.
"These smartphones will be the first in India to be powered by the MediaTek Dimensity 8350 chipset."

The launch of the Oppo Reno 13 series marks an important step in expanding Oppo's premium smartphone offerings in India.

item.title: New-age stock brokers feel pinch of marketing costs - The Economic Times
item.description:
New-age Stock Brokers Face Rising Marketing Costs Amid IPO Buzz

Publication Date: Not specified in the article
Source: Economic Times

The cost of acquiring customers has surged for new-age stockbrokers due to increased bidding rates for Google keywords, exacerbated by a growing interest in IPOs.

  • Stockbrokers are competing for keywords on platforms like Google and YouTube.
  • Bidding rates have doubled, increasing the cost of user acquisition for zero-commission brokers.
  • Key terms such as ‘demat account’ have seen significant price increases.
  • Regulatory changes have pushed brokers to refocus on app downloads rather than influencer marketing.
  • Most brokers are heavily investing in SEO and content creation to attract users.
“Digital marketing costs have shot up over the last year...getting customers to download the app on Google Play Store has gone up significantly.” - Sougata Basu, CashRich

This trend signals a major shift in how stock brokers must navigate customer acquisition as competition deepens in a relatively small trading market.
